info.name: Library
info.description: > **This collection provides a complete set of requests to interact with the API system, which manages books, households, users, and wishlists.**

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to add a new book to the system.

**Request**

Method: `POST`

URL: `http://localhost:3000/books`

**Request Headers:**

- `g-token` (string, required): The authorization token needed to authenticate the request.
    

**Request Body:**

- `title` (string, required): The title of the book.
    
- `author` (string, required): The author of the book.
    
- `isbn` (string, required): The ISBN number of the book.
    
- `releaseDate` (string, required): The release date of the book.
    

**Response**

Upon successful creation, the response will include the details of the newly added book, including its title, author, ISBN, release date, and timestamps for creation and update.

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to retrieve a list of all books in the system.

**Request**

Method: `GET`

URL: `http://localhost:3000/books`

**Request Headers:**

- `g-token` (string, required): The authorization token needed to authenticate the request.
    

**Response**

Upon successful retrieval, the response will include an array of all books, with their details such as title, author, ISBN, release date, and timestamps for creation and update.

response.name: Retrieve all books

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to retrieve the details of a specific book by its ID.

**Request**

Method: `GET`

URL: `http://localhost:3000/books/{id}`

(_Replace_ `{id}` _with the actual book ID._)

**Request Headers:**

- `g-token` (string, required): The authorization token needed to authenticate the request.
    

**Response**

Upon successful retrieval, the response will include the details of the book with the specified ID, such as title, author, ISBN, release date, and timestamps for creation and update.

exec: //Checking the status code of the response.
pm.test("Check the status code is 200", function () {
//Checking the response time of the response.
pm.test("Check the response time is less than 3000ms", function () {
pm.test("Check the schema of the response", function () {
//Check the value of book title is updated correctly
pm.test("Check the book title is updated correctly", function () {
//Check the value of book ISBN is updated correctly
pm.test("Check the book ISBN is updated correctly", function () {

- `author` (string, required): The author of the book.
    
- `isbn` (string, required): The ISBN number of the book.
    
- `releaseDate` (string, required): The release date of the book.
    

**Response**  
  
Upon successful update, the response will include the updated details of the book, including its title, author, ISBN, release date, and timestamps for creation and update.

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to update specific fields of a book without modifying the entire book. It uses the PATCH method.

**Request**  
  
Method: `PATCH`  
  
URL: `http://localhost:3000/books/{id}`  
  
(_Replace_ `_{id}_` _with the actual book ID._)

**Request Headers:**

- `g-token` (string, required): The authorization token needed to authenticate the request.
    

**Request Body:**  
  
You can update only the fields you want to change. You don't need to send the entire book object. The request body can contain one or more of the following fields:

- `title` (string, optional): The title of the book.
    
- `author` (string, optional): The author of the book.
    
- `isbn` (string, optional): The ISBN number of the book.
    
- `releaseDate` (string, optional): The release date of the book.
    

**Response**  
  
Upon successful partial update, the response will include the updated details of the book, including its title, author, ISBN, release date, and timestamps for creation and update.

exec: //Checking the status code of the response.
pm.test("Check the status code is 200", function () {
//Checking the response time of the response.
pm.test("Check the response time is less than 3000ms", function () {
//Check the value of book author is updated correctly
pm.test("Check the book author is updated correctly", function () {

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to retrieve the details of a book that has been partially updated.

**Request**

Method: `GET`

URL: `http://localhost:3000/books/{id}`

(_Replace_ `{id}` _with the actual book ID._)

**Request Headers:**

- `g-token` (string, required): The authorization token needed to authenticate the request.
    

**Response**

Upon successful retrieval, the response will include the updated details of the book, reflecting any changes made during the partial update. It will include the book's title, author, ISBN, release date, and timestamps for creation and update.

//Checking the response time of the response.
pm.test("Check the response time is less than 3000ms", function () {

request.description:

**Request**  
  
Method: `DELETE`  
  
URL: `http://localhost:3000/books/{id}`  
  
(_Replace_ `_{id}_` _with the actual book ID._)

**Request Headers:**

- `g-token` (string, required): The authorization token needed to authenticate the request.
    

**Response**  
  
Upon successful deletion, the response will return an empty body with no content.

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to attempt retrieving a book after it has been deleted.

**Request**  
  
Method: `GET`  
  
URL: `http://localhost:3000/books/{id}`  
  
(_Replace_ `_{id}_` _with the actual book ID._)

**Request Headers:**

- `g-token` (string, required): The authorization token needed to authenticate the request.
    

**Response**  
  
If the book has been deleted, the response will return a message indicating that the book was not found.

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to partially update specific fields of a wishlist.

**Request**

Method: `PATCH`

URL: `http://localhost:3000/wishlists/{id}`

**Request Headers:**

- `g-token` (string, required): The authorization token needed to authenticate the request.
    

**Request Body:**

- `name` (string, optional)
    
- `books` (array of numbers, optional)
    

**Response**

Upon successful partial update, the response will include the updated wishlist details.

exec: //Checking the status code of the response.
pm.test("Check the status code is 200", function () {
//Checking the response time of the response.
pm.test("Check the response time is less than 3000ms", function () {
//Check the wishlist books are updated correctly.
pm.test("Check the wishlist books are updated correctly", function () {

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to retrieve the details of a wishlist after it has been partially updated.

**Request**

Method: `GET`

URL: `http://localhost:3000/wishlists/{id}`

**Request Headers:**

- `g-token` (string, required): The authorization token needed to authenticate the request.
    

**Response**

Upon successful retrieval, the response will include the updated details of the wishlist.

exec: //Checking the status code of the response.
pm.test("Check the status code is 204", function () {
//Checking the response time of the response.
pm.test("Check the response time is less than 3000ms", function () {

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to delete a wishlist by its ID.

**Request**  
  
Method: `DELETE`  
  
URL: `http://localhost:3000/wishlists/{id}`

**Request Headers:**

- `g-token` (string, required): The authorization token needed to authenticate the request.
    

**Response**  
  
Upon successful deletion, the response will return an empty body with no content.

exec: //Checking the status code of the response.
pm.test("Check the status code is 404", function () {
//Checking the response time of the response.
pm.test("Check the response time is less than 3000ms", function () {
//Check the message in the response body.
pm.test("Check the message in the response body", function () {

request.description:
This endpoint allows you to attempt retrieving a wishlist after it has been deleted.

**Request**  
  
Method: `GET`  
  
URL: `http://localhost:3000/wishlists/{id}`

**Request Headers:**

- `g-token` (string, required): The authorization token needed to authenticate the request.
    

**Response**  
  
If the wishlist has been deleted, the response will return a message indicating that the wishlist was not found.

item.description: > **This folder contains requests to manage wishlists, including adding, updating, finding, and deleting wishlist items.**
